intro: Juncus articulatus f. viridiflorus, commonly known as the greenflower rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Juncaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, jointed stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences, giving it its distinctive appearance. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils along stream banks and in wetlands. This variant is notable for its unique floral coloration, which sets it apart from other members of the Juncus genus.
